column4: hey, could someone kinda help me insatll GCC? I've download the right files and when I go to configure I get this error, /tmp/cNf8287/cNf8287.pos: line 8: cc: command not found
and you'll get gcc with that
you might try sudo apt-get install gcc-4.0 if you want gcc 4.0
I just do that in the synaptic package manager?
you might do it there as well
it doesn't matter if you do it in synaptic, aptitude or apt-get.
It's finished with the installing part
try "gcc-4.0", did you install build-essentials as well? AFAIR the default gcc version is 3.4 and it is brought in as a dependancy od build-essentials
gcc-4.0 works. but the things i'm installing that need GCC don't detect it. I guess thats because the command "gcc" wont work?
if not, you might uninstall gcc-4.0 and install build-essentials
gcc will be brought in with build-essentials
sorry to sound like an idiot. but how di i build the essentials? it's command line arguement
with synaptic or whatever you prefer
